titleStmt.title: The lovers dreame: who sleeping, thought he did imbrace his love, which when he wak'd, did no such matter prove; yet afterwards her love he did enjoy, by sending a letter by a trusty young boy. To the tune of, I laid me downe to sleepe.

publicationStmt.publisher: For I.W. dwelling in Gilt-spur street,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "As I was walking all alone ..."
In two parts, separated for mounting; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
